revised_title: Aircraft Attack on Locust Swarms: Development and Control Systems
tldr: The article discusses the development of aircraft attack on locust swarms in Africa since 1945 and the start of operational research on control systems. The author describes the strategy and tactics used to control migrant pests, focusing on the behavior of locust swarms and the effectiveness of insecticide spraying from aircraft. The article highlights the importance of understanding locust behavior and the role of wind in determining the success of control efforts.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Biodiversity
